verses.verse: Dead <WH4194> flies <WH2070> cause the ointment <WH8081> of the apothecary <WH7543> to send forth <WH5042> a stinking savor: <WH887> so doth a little <WH4592> folly <WH5531> him that is in reputation <WH3368> for wisdom <WH4480> <WH2451> and honor. <WH4480> <WH3519>
A wise man's <WH2450> heart <WH3820> is at his right hand; <WH3225> but a fool's <WH3684> heart <WH3820> at his left. <WH8040>

Yea also, <WH1571> when he that is a fool <WH7945> <WH5530> walketh <WH1980> by the way, <WH1870> his wisdom <WH3820> faileth <WH2638> him, and he saith <WH559> to every one <WH3605> that he <WH1931> is a fool. <WH5530>

If <WH518> the spirit <WH7307> of the ruler <WH4910> rise up <WH5927> against <WH5921> thee, leave <WH5117> not <WH408> thy place; <WH4725> for <WH3588> yielding <WH4832> pacifieth <WH5117> great <WH1419> offenses. <WH2399>
There is <WH3426> an evil <WH7451> which I have seen <WH7200> under <WH8478> the sun, <WH8121> as an error <WH7684> which proceedeth <WH7945> <WH3318> from <WH4480> <WH6440> the ruler: <WH7989>
Folly <WH5529> is set <WH5414> in great <WH7227> dignity, <WH4791> and the rich <WH6223> sit <WH3427> in low place. <WH8216>
I have seen <WH7200> servants <WH5650> upon <WH5921> horses, <WH5483> and princes <WH8269> walking <WH1980> as servants <WH5650> upon <WH5921> the earth. <WH776>
He that diggeth <WH2658> a pit <WH1475> shall fall <WH5307> into it; and whoso breaketh <WH6555> a hedge, <WH1447> a serpent <WH5175> shall bite <WH5391> him.
Whoso removeth <WH5265> stones <WH68> shall be hurt <WH6087> therewith; and he that cleaveth <WH1234> wood <WH6086> shall be endangered <WH5533> thereby.

If <WH518> the iron <WH1270> be blunt, <WH6949> and he <WH1931> do not <WH3808> whet <WH7043> the edge, <WH6440> then must he put to <WH1396> more strength: <WH2428> but wisdom <WH2451> is profitable <WH3504> to direct. <WH3787>
Surely <WH518> the serpent <WH5175> will bite <WH5391> without <WH3808> enchantment; <WH3908> and a babbler <WH1167> <WH3956> is no <WH369> better. <WH3504>
The words <WH1697> of a wise man's <WH2450> mouth <WH6310> are gracious; <WH2580> but the lips <WH8193> of a fool <WH3684> will swallow up <WH1104> himself.
The beginning <WH8462> of the words <WH1697> of his mouth <WH6310> is foolishness: <WH5531> and the end <WH319> of his talk <WH6310> is mischievous <WH7451> madness. <WH1948>

A fool <WH5530> also is full <WH7235> of words: <WH1697> a man <WH120> cannot <WH3808> tell <WH3045> what shall be; <WH4100> <WH7945> <WH1961> and what <WH834> shall be <WH1961> after <WH4480> <WH310> him, who <WH4310> can tell <WH5046> him?
The labor <WH5999> of the foolish <WH3684> wearieth <WH3021> every one of them, because <WH834> he knoweth <WH3045> not <WH3808> how to go <WH1980> to <WH413> the city. <WH5892>
Woe <WH337> to thee, O land, <WH776> when thy king <WH7945> <WH4428> is a child, <WH5288> and thy princes <WH8269> eat <WH398> in the morning! <WH1242>

Blessed <WH835> art thou, O land, <WH776> when thy king <WH7945> <WH4428> is the son <WH1121> of nobles, <WH2715> and thy princes <WH8269> eat <WH398> in due season, <WH6256> for strength, <WH1369> and not <WH3808> for drunkenness! <WH8358>
By much slothfulness <WH6103> the building <WH4746> decayeth; <WH4355> and through idleness <WH8220> of the hands <WH3027> the house <WH1004> droppeth through. <WH1811>
A feast <WH3899> is made <WH6213> for laughter, <WH7814> and wine <WH3196> maketh merry: <WH8055> <WH2416> but money <WH3701> answereth <WH6030> <WH853> all <WH3605> things.

Curse <WH7043> not <WH408> the king, <WH4428> no <WH1571> not in thy thought; <WH4093> and curse <WH7043> not <WH408> the rich <WH6223> in thy bedchamber: <WH2315> <WH4904> for <WH3588> a bird <WH5775> of the air <WH8064> shall carry <WH1980> <WH853> the voice, <WH6963> and that which hath <WH1167> wings <WH3671> shall tell <WH5046> the matter. <WH1697>
